p: Madaleno et al. (2018) focused on the factors affecting CO2 emissions in 23 countries, including Australia, for the period between 1985 and 2011. Adopting the LMDI method, the researchers focused on the impact of six factors on CO2 emissions — namely, carbon trade intensity, the trade of fossil fuels effect, fossil fuels intensity, renewable sources productivity, the electricity financial power effect, and the financial development effect. The researchers concluded that the productivity of renewable sources and the financial development effect in renewable electricity production per GDP were the two leading determinants of CO2 emissions. In addition, they reported that the fossil fuel energy consumption effect increased CO2 emissions in the research countries.
